content: omg, emails were broken because my url didn't have "/messages" on the end.

I found this image on my hard drive. I think the source is here: https://nbviewer.org/github/akittas/presentations/blob/master/pythess/meta_alltheway/meta_alltheway.ipynb

Metaclasses in Python are fun, especially if you're making a library... but if you can avoid using them, then you won't have to understand this diagram. Which is probably a good idea if you want to write maintainable code 😛 #blog
images: a flowchart explaining Python's class and instance creation flow

content: https://gist.github.com/tassaron/2e1c1bd5d67202d9daf191eec93b1f6a Script to poll for my Mastodon statuses and turn them into JSON. It paginates them into groups of 5. Now I just have to make some HTML for it. Honestly that's the hardest part; I don't know where I want this newsfeed/blog or what I want it to look like :P
There are more appropriate paginating formats than folders of JSON files, but I really like JSON and it should be good enough
